conclusion: List the data and symbols: length of the rod L, spring constant k, uniform magnetic field B, mass of the rod m, first current I₁, second current I₂, required extension Δ.
Magnetic force on a straight conductor: F_m = I L B, direction given by right-hand rule.
Condition when springs are slack (current = I₁): I₁ L B = mg.
Forces when current is reversed and increased to I₂: F′_m = I₂ L B (downward), F_down = mg + I₂ L B.
Relate F_down to spring extensions: 2 k Δ = F_down.
Eliminate unknown weight mg: mg = I₁ L B, insert into F_down and spring equation.
Solve for the extension Δ: Δ = L B (I₁ + I₂) / (2 k).
Result: Elongation of each spring when current flows from b to a with magnitude I₂ is Δ = (L B / 2k) · (I₁ + I₂).
